                            <div id="parent1018692" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1018692" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Samamtha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/905118"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.905118.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Samamtha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-and-James/Nirvana-Bourbon-40269.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40269.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nirvana Bourbon"title="Nirvana Bourbon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1018692ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1018692" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/905118">Samamtha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-09">01/09/19 16:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm loving this EDP! For whatever reason, by wearing it I'm transported back in time ca 1930, on a steam boat - something like an exotic cruise trip on the river Nile with Agatha Christie (or indeed Hercule Poirot)! It's a scent that captures my idea of good old days when the upper crust dressed impeccably to the nines on their vacation/cruise. Elegant, clean, beautifully classy, ever-so-slightly sweet. This is also a truly unisex scent too, not too sharp, not too sweet; it's the best blend of so many different elements. Oh it's exquisitely delightful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="1018692"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=1018692#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1018395" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1018395" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosequeen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1169399.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosequeen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Raphael/Replique-5132.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5132.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Replique"title="Replique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1018395ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1018395" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399">rosequeen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-08">01/08/19 19:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been wearing Penhaligon's Savoy Steam EDP all day today and reveling in it.  I really like it and have wondered why it gets so many negative reviews.  I've come to the conclusion that few people connect in a positive way with steam.  <br />
<br />
I don't know what else they could have called it though.  It smells like a steam bath after someone has sprayed a 30's or 40's mens' rose scented cologne.  So that really limits the number of people who have this association.  Even I wasn't alive in the 1930's or early 1940's, and Penhaligon's target market certainly wasn't either.  <br />
<br />
I wonder how they described this fragrance in their "concept" meetings at Penhaligon's, which they must have when they're deciding which of their perfumers latest creations to promote.  Here's my take.  The original description of Savoy Steam did associate it with the Savoy Hotel, but I suspect it was without their permission because that verbiage was dropped pretty soon afterwards.  <br />
<br />
What I think Penhaligon's was trying to evoke was a vision of the interior of the Savoy Hotel for people who have never actually been inside.  Think of a white or light grey marble steam room, with white marble flooring with those little square or hexagon shaped tiles from the 1930's, and maybe windows high up in the walls so you can see the light grey sky down by the Thames.  Savoy Steam is not a sunshine and roses perfume; it's definitely a cold grey day fragrance. (That alone must disappoint many buyers.)<br />
<br />
Ok, a vision that would appeal to a limited number of people.  Might not even be an age thing; the Savoy has been used as a backdrop for several mysteries and spy thrillers. Maybe Penhaligon's thought they'd reach that market too, people from 25-95 who read a lot, fantasize a lot, look at the sky on grey days, and love wearing an unusual rose scented perfume.  It's not a stretch; after all, Penhaligon's thought there was a market for a sea of odd perfumes with snobby names sold in bottles with tops resembling weird chess pieces.  (Who has time to keep track of them?)<br />
<br />
But I enjoy wearing Savoy Steam EDP anyway, and hope it stays around a little longer.  I sprayed it on 9 hours ago and can still smell it.  All it takes is the ability and desire to imagine a marble steam room.  (Savoy Steam will probably not help people who use perfume to attract someone.)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="1018395"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=1018395#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1501505" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1501505" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LauraAD"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1339124"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LauraAD" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jeroboam/Ligno-54995.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54995.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ligno"title="Ligno"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1501505ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1501505" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1339124">LauraAD</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-10">02/10/22 05:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I spray this on I am instantly transported. It opens as tea and eucalyptus with something of freshly squeezed lemonade garnished with sprig of mint. It evokes a memory of sitting in a humid, tropical country, in the blazing sun with a refreshing drink with the ice melting and condensation on the outside of the glass. As it dries down it reminds me of the scent of a luxury spa, even down to managing to smell slightly steamy. The rose is rich but subtle, coming to the fore only after 30 minutes or so, but still with that fizzy lemonade tang over the top.<br />
I really love this, especially for the summer. Bravo, Penhaligon's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="1501505"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=1501505#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1356458" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="witch_x3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254041.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="witch_x3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jessica-Simpson/Fancy-4094.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4094.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fancy"title="Fancy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1356458ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1356458" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041">witch_x3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-08">06/08/21 05:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is really unique and lovely. It is very much a unisex scent. It has a clean musky warm feel to it without being soapy or fresh. Spraying this feels like a warm towel in a lovely steamy spa. It's lightly sweet at times but mostly aromatic. This is one of those scents that I feel everyone would like as it isn't too in your face and could easily seem like you aren't wearing anything at all and that's just 'how you smell!' I think this would be great in all seasons but be best from Spring to Fall.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="1356458"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=1356458#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2055617" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2055617" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="qqcheeky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321019"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="qqcheeky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Omnia-Crystalline-152.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.152.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Omnia Crystalline"title="Omnia Crystalline"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2055617ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2055617" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321019">qqcheeky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-08">02/08/24 00:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive never left a review here before but here goes.<br />
<br />
It was summer and I was walking about London and stumbled into a Penhaligons store in Covent Garden. I never explored the house before and I thought Id walk in and smell some of the scents out of curiosity.<br />
<br />
I smelled quite a few of their signature scents that the sales woman suggested but nothing really spoke to me. I told her Im quite into more aromatic scents but I dont like when they lean too masculine. She suggested Savoy Steam and it was love at first sniff. I didnt expect to love it so much and even the sales person was surprised as Im assuming this scent is not very popular.<br />
<br />
She sprayed some on a handkerchief for me and I walked out and spent the next few days constantly looking for the handkerchief to smell it again and again.<br />
<br />
Anyways, 2 months later I bought it and now Im wondering if Ill ever find another fragrance as awesome as this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="2055617"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=2055617#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="42702" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent804145" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc804145" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma804145ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd804145" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-20">03/20/17 15:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nope. Was quite excited by the thought of this as I find Hammam Bouquet enjoyable. The perfume of this is boring weak sauce. There is no bite, it's so flat. I've not tried the cologne yet and I'm hoping for better as it has different notes on their website.<br />
<br />
This perfume is well balanced and not unpleasant in any way. It's a light, balanced floral and some people will enjoy that. However it is so generic and flat. A general peachy rose smell that inspires no emotion and makes you feel nothing. It goes in no particular direction, there is no hook or reason to want this scent in your life. <br />
<br />
If this was a cheap room spray or candle it would be an acceptable scent, not what I'd choose but I could accept it's existence. <br />
<br />
For a perfume that is supposed to hark back to Hammam or for something that costs over 130, Savoy Steam is a disgrace.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="804145"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=804145#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1244818" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1244818" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ladybird1000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263544"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263544.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ladybird1000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1244818ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1244818" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263544">ladybird1000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-04">11/04/20 15:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to like this fragrance. The name was intriguing and the idea of steam in a bottle sounded very exotic. With a first spray you can indeed smell the steam, which is pleasantly accompanied by cardamon, eucalyptus and pink pepper. It is very refreshing and calming at the same time. It makes you think of the good times: summer time laziness, relaxing bath and even custard buns and vanilla ice cream. It's gentle so you want to spray more and more...and more. And this is when you go wrong. In about 10 minutes it dries into a suffocating rose, you feel like a scarf is tightening on your neck, it's nauseating and headache evoking. You start to regret the last few splashes. However, you try not to panic and wait for the base notes, and ...nothing. The rose is aggressive, it penetrates your nose right into your brain. <br />
<br />
The rose note in the Savoy Steam is not a typical rose note. Usually rose fragrances make me think of my grandmother who used to keep rose soaps in an old, beautifully carved black wooden cabinet. She would cover the cabinet with an embroidered cloth and keep a few roses from her garden in a small vase on top of it. The whole room smelled of love and warmth evoking roses. The rose note in this fragrance is citrus-sour and thorny. It's like being criticized for something you did not intend. <br />
<br />
I suspect that if you like citrus and rose, you might like this fragrance. It is definitely unusual and initially, it does smell like steam, which I am still mesmerized by. Purchasing this fragrance was definitely an interesting experience, I have been trying to crack the shocking difference between the top and the middle notes all day. The rose in this case definitely broke my heart so I will be divorcing myself from this fragrance ;)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="1244818"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=1244818#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent827680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc827680" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vinyl_junky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vinyl_junky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/GFT-5004.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5004.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="GFT"title="GFT"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma827680ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd827680" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736">vinyl_junky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-31">05/31/17 00:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As some reviews below have noted, the EDP and the EDC are listed separately in the database, as they should be - both fragrances are very different. I have only the EDP, received as a sample with my last purchase. <br />
<br />
I was expecting something similar to Hammam Boquet, but was severely disappointed. Savoy Steam is nowhere close. It's a light, slightly sweet, rose floral. That's it. It's pretty one-dimensional, you basically get a whiff of rose, and that's about it. <br />
<br />
As per the salesman at the store, the "Savoy" in the name comes from a tie up they have with the Savoy hotel in London (couldn't find any information to support this). The the "Steam" refers to the steam process by which the rose is extracted, which preserves all of the essential oils. But hey, a rose by any other name...<br />
<br />
Longevity is poor, I get around an hour and this is a skin scent on me. <br />
<br />
For the USD 175 you'd have to shell out for 100ml of this, you can pick up around 4.5 litres of rosewater from the nearest chemist which will give you pretty much the same scent with about the same performance. I don't think I'll be investing in a full bottle...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="827680"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=827680#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1635654" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1635654" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="notnati"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1539631"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1539631.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="notnati" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Skin-35244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Skin"title="Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1635654ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1635654" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1539631">notnati</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-01">09/01/22 03:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very geranium-heavy. All other notes are overpowered by it. We will not be friends. I usually like geranium but it's quite heavy and unpleasant in here - a better option would be Diptyque's Geranium Odorata.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="1635654"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=1635654#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2075930" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2075930" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="deslilas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1214397"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1214397.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="deslilas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Apres-l-Ondee-13.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Apres l'Ondee"title="Apres l'Ondee"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2075930ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2075930" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1214397">deslilas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-27">02/27/24 13:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wait, there's a "eau de cologne" of this as well? I wonder if that is as bad as this. I don't know why, but it just smelled awful on me. I got a spray from a perfume counter, and it just smelled like an abused rose. A rose that has been tortured and left for dead. It was sad, angering even, with no other notes coming out in any signifiant way. Extremely disappointing and even offensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="42702"comment_id="2075930"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Savoy-Steam-42702.html?ccid=2075930#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="42702" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

    <div class="latest-list flex-container">

            <span class="brand">Olfactive Studio</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Dancing Light</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="I hate when people write reviews that seem to be driven by the power of suggestion. In this case, the promise of a scent that is would be a representation of something as spectacular and unique as the Aurora Borealis. This fragrance is just a soapy white floral scent with some green notes....">by
            <em>aspirina</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.128870.jpg"
                                                     style="width: 2em; height: 2em; border-radius: 1em"></span>
    </div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">
        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/m.95956.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>
        <a href="/perfume/Calvin-Klein/CK-One-Essence-95956.html#cc2367107"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Calvin Klein</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">CK One Essence</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"

                <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Brands</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Lattafa-Perfumes.html" class="en2inter">Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Dior.html" class="en2inter">Dior</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">3.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Tom-Ford.html" class="en2inter">Tom Ford</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">4.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Yves-Saint-Laurent.html" class="en2inter">Yves Saint Laurent</a>
        </span>
    </div>

        </span>

            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">52.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Avon.html" class="en2inter">Avon</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">53.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Azzaro.html" class="en2inter">Azzaro</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">54.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Narciso-Rodriguez.html" class="en2inter">Narciso Rodriguez</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">55.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Frederic-Malle.html" class="en2inter">Frederic Malle</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">56.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Montblanc.html" class="en2inter">Montblanc</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">

        </span>
    </div>

        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

    <script>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
